definition[0]: an animal, bird etc that is hunted and eaten by another animal
definition[1]: the TARGET COMPANY (=the company that another company wants to buy) in a takeover
example[1]: MIN would prefer to be predator  (=a company that buys another company) rather than prey, but it was outbid in its last attempt to buy a regional newspaper.
definition[2]: to be unable to avoid a harmful or difficult situation
example[2]: After opening higher, the OTC market fell prey to profit-taking.
example[3]: The once-soaring South Korean economy has fallen prey to steep wage increases and high inflation.
